bibl.title: Sleepers Awake: More Light on PSI I 65.
bibl.note: P.S.I. I, 65 (= van Haelst 1174; LDAB 6271). "While this sixth-century text has hitherto been interpreted as either exegetical or mystical, the present paper proposes that it is in fact a draft of a liturgical formulation, specifically a fragment of an ordination rite for clergy of the separating Miaphysite church of Egypt."
bibl.seg: MacCOULL Leslie S.B., Sleepers Awake: More Light on PSI I 65.

P.S.I. I, 65 (= van Haelst 1174; LDAB 6271). "While this sixth-century text has hitherto been interpreted as either exegetical or mystical, the present paper proposes that it is in fact a draft of a liturgical formulation, specifically a fragment of an ordination rite for clergy of the separating Miaphysite church of Egypt."
